intro: Cnidoscolus bellator var. bullatus, commonly known as the Bullatus Burr cucumber, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of stinging hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers that give way to edible, spiny fruits resembling small cucumbers. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid tropical regions.
